sen.j: 一条通（いちじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Ichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Ichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Ichijo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の一条大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Ichijo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Ichijo-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Ichijo-oji Street of Heian-kyo.
Its east end is the Karasuma-dori Street.
Its eastern end is Karasuma-dori Street.
Its eastern end is Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 西は右京区花園付近までだが、さらに西に延長して嵯峨野の清凉寺（嵯峨釈迦堂）までを一条通と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: In the west, it ends around Hanazono, Ukyo Ward, but some refer to the street extended west to Seiryo-ji Temple Saga-Shakado in Sagano as the Ichijo Street.
In the west, it ends around Hanazono, Ukyo ward, but some refer to the street that extends west to Seiryo-ji Temple Saga-Shakado in Sagano as Ichijo Street.
In the west, it ends around Hanazono in Ukyo Ward, but some refer to the street, which extends west to Seiryo-ji Temple (Saga-Shakado) in Sagano, as Ichijo-dori Street.

sen.j: また宇多野で分岐して周山街道にも通じている。
sen.e: It also branches at Utano and leads to the Shuzan-kaido Road.
It also branches at Utano and leads to Shuzan-kaido Road.
It also branches at Utano and leads to Shuzan-kaido Road.

sen.j: 平安京の北端の通りであったが、平安時代中期以降は一条大路を越えて北へ市街地が拡大した。
sen.e: Though the the Ichijo-oji Street formed the northern edge of Heiankyo, the downtown area expanded across it after the middle of Heian era.
Though the Ichijo-oji Street formed the northern edge of Heiankyo, the downtown area expanded across it after the middle of Heian era.
Though Ichijo-oji Street formed the northern edge of Heian-kyo, the downtown area expanded across it northward after the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: Heian-kyo, period に修正 northward追加

sen.j: 京都御所の北端の大路という位置付けは現在、その北側を走る今出川通が果たしている。
sen.e: The Imadegawa-dori Street, which runs along the north side of the Ichi-dori Street, now acts as the north edge of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace).
Imadegawa-dori Street, which runs along the north side of Ichi-dori Street, now acts as the northern boundary of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace).
Imadegawa-dori Street now acts as the northern boundary of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace), which runs along its north side.

sen.j: 現在は市中心部では一方通行の狭い通りである。
sen.e: Now, the Ichijo-dori Street in the central Kyoto City is a narrow one-way.
Ichijo-dori Street, in central Kyoto City, is a narrow one-way road.
Ichijo-dori Street, in central Kyoto City, is a narrow one-way road.

sen.j: 堀川 (京都府)にかかる一条戻橋が有名である。
sen.e: Ichijomodori-bashi Bridge over Horikawa is well known.
Ichijomodori-bashi Bridge over Horikawa is well known.
Ichijomodori-bashi Bridge, which spans the Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), is well known.
sen.cmt: (Kyoto Prefecture) 追加 Hori-kawa Riverとしました。

sen.e: Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street
Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street
Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street

sen.j: 東一条通（ひがしいちじょうどおり）は鴨川 (淀川水系)を挟んで一条通の延長線上にあり、西は川端通から東は吉田神社鳥居前まで。
sen.e: The Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street, which forms a extended line of the ichijo-dori Street across the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system), runs from the Kawabata-dori Street in the west to Yoshida-jinja Shrine Torimae in the east.

Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street, which forms an extended line of Ichijo-dori Street across the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa Water System), runs from Kawabata-dori Street in the west to Yoshida-jinja Shrine Torimae in the east.

Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street, which forms an extended line of Ichijo-dori Street across the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa River system), runs from Kawabata-dori Street in the west to the gate (Torii) of Yoshida-jinja Shrine in the east.
sen.cmt: Yodo-gawa River system, gate (Torii) of the Yoshida-jinja Shrine としました。

sen.j: 東大路通から東は吉田神社の参道であり、節分祭の折りになると露店でにぎわう。
sen.e: The east of the Higashioji Street is the approach to Yoshida-jinja Shrine, along which there are many street stalls with a lively atmosphere during the Setsubun Festival, the bean-throwing festival of celebrating the coming of spring.

The east of Higashioji Street is the approach to Yoshida-jinja Shrine, along which there are many street stalls with a lively atmosphere during the Setsubun Festival, the bean-throwing festival to celebrate the coming of spring.

The east of Higashi-ichijo Street is the approach to Yoshida-jinja Shrine, along which there are many street stalls with a lively atmosphere during the Setsubun Festival, the bean-throwing festival to celebrate the coming of spring.
sen.cmt: 東大路通から ではなく、 東一条通り ではないかと解釈し、修正しました。

sen.j: またこの区間の両側は京都大学のキャンパスであり、正門も東一条通に面している。
sen.e: The both sides of this section is the campus of Kyoto University, whose main gate also faces the Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street.
Both sides of this section comprise the campus of Kyoto University, whose main gate also faces Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street.
Both sides of this section comprise the campus of Kyoto University, whose main gate also faces Higashi-Ichijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 4月の入学シーズンには京都大学の課外活動へ勧誘する立て看板が林立する。
sen.e: In every April when new students enter the university, many sign boards are erected for recurring students to extracurricular activities.
Each April, when new students enter the university, many signboards are erected to remind returning students of extracurricular activities.
Each April, when new students enter the university, many signboards are erected to remind returning students of extracurricular activities.
Crossing Roads
Crossing roads
Crossing roads

sen.j: ここでは、市中心部の一方通行の狭い通りについては記述しない。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
The narrow, one-way roads running in the center of the city aren't mentioned here.

sen.j: 上側が東側、下側が西側。
sen.e: East is upper and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.
East is upper, and west is lower.

sen.j: 左側が北側、右側が南側。
sen.e: North is left and south is right.
North is to the left, and south is to the right.
North is to the left, and south is to the right.
